newsitem.title: USA: American Express Travel unit CFO resigns.
newsitem.headline: American Express Travel unit CFO resigns.

text.p: American Express Co said Walter Berman, the chief financial officer of its Travel Related Services unit and treasurer of American Express Co has resigned.
In a letter to American Express employees, American Express Chairman and Chief Executive Harvey Golub, said Berman was leaving the company to form his own consulting practice.
The practice will advise senior leaders of major companies on corporate finance, acquisitions, re-engineering and "maximizing shareholder value."
Golub said the company will begin a process to select a successor to Berman when Richard Goeltz, the new chief financial officer and vice chairman of American Express arrives in early September.
He said that candidates both from within and outside the company would be considered as replacements.
In the interim, the Travel Related Services business unit chief financial officers will report both to Goeltz and to the heads of their respective business units.
All of Berman's other direct reports will be managed by Goeltz during the transition period, Golub said.

Berman had held a succession of increasingly senior positions wit American Express since he joined the company in 1965, with the exception of a break between 1969 to 1973 when he worked for American Airlines.
